com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware

Interface DeviceInterfaceModule

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AnalogInputController, AnalogOutputController, DigitalChannelController, HardwareDevice, I2cController, PWMOutputController
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ModernRoboticsUsbDeviceInterfaceModule

    public interface DeviceInterfaceModule
extends DigitalChannelController, AnalogInputController, PWMOutputController, I2cController, AnalogOutputController
    Represents a Modern Robotics Device Interface Module. Beyond being an AnalogInputController, an AnalogOutputController, a DigitalChannelController, an I2cController, and a PWMOutputController, it is also possible to control all the digital ports at once and to control the LEDs.

    • Nested Class Summary

    • Method Detail

      • getDigitalInputStateByte

        int getDigitalInputStateByte()
        Gets the signal level of all the digital ports. If a port is set as an output port, it returns the last set value. If a port is set as an input port, it returns the value currently being read.
        Returns:
        a bitmask where ((bitmask >> portNumber) & 1) == 1 will be true iff there is a signal on the port

      • setDigitalIOControlByte

        void setDigitalIOControlByte(byte input)
        Sets whether each digital port is an input or an output.
        Parameters:
        input - a bitmask where (bitmask >> portNumber) & 1 is 1 if the port should become an output port, 0 if it should become an input port

      • getDigitalIOControlByte

        byte getDigitalIOControlByte()
        Gets whether each digital port is an input or an output.
        Returns:
        a bitmask where (bitmask >> portNumber) & 1 is 1 if the port is an output port, 0 if it is an input port
        See Also:
        setDigitalIOControlByte(byte)

      • setDigitalOutputByte

        void setDigitalOutputByte(byte input)
        Sets whether each digital output port is activated. If any ports are set as inputs, they will not be affected.
        Parameters:
        input - a bitmask where (bitmask >> portNumber) & 1 == 1 iff the port should output a signal

      • getDigitalOutputStateByte

        byte getDigitalOutputStateByte()
        Gets whether each digital output port is activated.
        Returns:
        a bitmask where (bitmask >> portNumber) & 1 == 1 iff the port is outputing a signal
        See Also:
        setDigitalOutputByte(byte)

      • getLEDState

        boolean getLEDState(int channel)
        Gets whether the specified LED is turned on.
        Parameters:
        channel - use 0 for the blue LED, 1 for the red LED
        Returns:
        true iff the led is turned on
        See Also:
        setLED(int, boolean)

      • setLED

        void setLED(int channel,
            boolean state)
        Turns the specified LED on or off.
        Parameters:
        channel - use 0 for the blue LED, 1 for the red LED
        state - true will turn on the LED, false will turn it off
